dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: President Tokayev just laid out a vision for universities to become real pioneers in research and innovation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: President Tokayev just laid out a vision for universities to become real pioneers in research and innovation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Universities should become pioneers in research and innovation, President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev said during a public address, according to a statement from Akorda.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he pointed out that Kazakhstan already has ten research universities, but he said that's not enough for the full development of science.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he pointed out that Kazakhstan already has ten research universities, but he said that's not enough for the full development of science.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan currently has ten institutions designated as research universities. However, this is not enough for the full development of science.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, he really emphasized that education and science have to go hand in hand—they can't just focus on training specialists alone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, he really emphasized that education and science have to go hand in hand-they can't just focus on training specialists alone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Head of State noted that while educational institutions focus primarily on training specialists, scientific research should also be a key priority. He emphasized that education and science must go hand in hand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the numbers are pretty striking—over 40 billion tenge in revenue from applied research in the last five years? That's a huge economic impact.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the numbers are pretty striking-over forty billion tenge in revenue from applied research in the last five years? That's a huge economic impact.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over the past five years, scientific organizations engaged in applied research have generated over 40 billion tenge in revenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and private investment reached 14.5 billion tenge too. It's not just public money; businesses are starting to see the value.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and private investment reached fourteen point five billion tenge too. It's not just public money; businesses are starting to see the value.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Private investment in science has reached 14.5 billion tenge, and more than 2,000 new jobs have been created.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I love the example with Satbayev University—their work on ultra-pure selenium increased its value per kilogram fifteen times. That's a game-changer for the industry.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I love the example with Satbayev University-their work on ultra-pure selenium increased its value per kilogram fifteen times. That's a game-changer for the industry.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One example, he said, is Satbayev University, where scientists developed an innovative technology to produce ultra-pure selenium. As a result, the price of selenium per kilogram increased 15-fold, generating an additional 1.2 billion tenge in profit for the processing company.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it brought in an extra 1.2 billion tenge profit! That's the kind of tangible benefit he's talking about.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it brought in an extra one point two billion tenge profit! That's the kind of tangible benefit he's talking about.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a result, the price of selenium per kilogram increased 15-fold, generating an additional 1.2 billion tenge in profit for the processing company.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Then there's Durvudkhan Suragan—his math physics research is being used in cryptography and data protection. Perfect for the digital era.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Then there's Durvudkhan Suragan-his math physics research is being used in cryptography and data protection. Perfect for the digital era.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President also praised the work of young academician Durvudkhan Suragan, whose research in mathematical physics has been successfully applied in cryptography and data protection systems.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Tokayev really stressed cooperation between businesses, unis, and research centers. He even mentioned that some companies are now allocating one percent of revenue to science.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Tokayev really stressed cooperation between businesses, unis, and research centers. He even mentioned that some companies are now allocating one percent of revenue to science.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He called on domestic enterprises to contribute more actively to the development of science, stressing the importance of cooperation between businesses, universities, and research centers to create new products. He also noted that it is a strategically important step that major industrial companies in Kazakhstan are now allocating one percent of their revenues to science.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which honestly feels like a smart move—it's investing in the future, not just short-term gains.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which honestly feels like a smart move-it's investing in the future, not just short-term gains.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And he signed a decree to award scientists for outstanding work, which is a great way to incentivize innovation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he signed a decree to award scientists for outstanding work, which is a great way to incentivize innovation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, President Tokayev signed a decree on awarding scientists for outstanding achievements in the field of science and technology.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds like Kazakhstan is building a whole ecosystem where science isn't just theoretical—it's driving real economic growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It sounds like Kazakhstan is building a whole ecosystem where science isn't just theoretical-it's driving real economic growth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. When universities and industries collaborate like this, everyone benefits—new jobs, new tech, stronger national security.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. When universities and industries collaborate like this, everyone benefits-new jobs, new tech, stronger national security.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder if other countries should take note—this integrated approach could be a blueprint.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes you wonder if other countries should take note-this integrated approach could be a blueprint.
